intro: [WRONG START] Hieracius melachaeta, commonly known as the black hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the dandelion family (Compositae) and is characterized by its dark green, hairy leaves and yellowish flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its flowers are composite, consisting of many small florets arranged in a head, and it produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Hieracium melachaeta is often found in open habitats and can sometimes form dense colonies.
